meanings.definition: A member of the Society of Jesus, a Roman Catholic religious order founded by St. Ignatius Loyola in 1534.
meanings.sent1: The jesuits at the church were known for their dedication to helping others.
meanings.sent2: The jesuits in the monastery spent their days in prayer and study.
meanings.sent3: When the jesuits organized a charity event, everyone was amazed by their generosity.
meanings.sent4: The jesuits' commitment to their beliefs was as strong as a towering oak tree.
meanings.sent5: The jesuits' influence in the community was undeniable and inspiring.

meanings.definition: A person who is cunning or deceitful in their actions.
meanings.sent1: The jesuits in the story used their cleverness to outsmart their rivals.
meanings.sent2: She was a jesuits who always had a trick up her sleeve.
meanings.sent3: The jesuits' plan to surprise their friends with a party was a success.
meanings.sent4: His smile was as deceptive as a jesuits' disguise.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the jesuits' smooth talk; they may have hidden intentions.
